steps.speak: Salve! Welcome to Week 12 Day 1. Let’s recall our –āre verbs from last week. Say amō, amās, amat …
Excellent! Those belong to the First Conjugation. Today we meet a new family that likes a long ē sound – the Second Conjugation.
Our new verbs are videō (I see), moneō (I warn), teneō (I hold), habeō (I have), timeō (I fear). Repeat each after me.
Chant with me: videō, vidēs, videt / vidēmus, vidētis, vident.
Compare with Week 11 –āre verbs: amō vs videō, amās vs vidēs … Notice how the sound changes from short a to long ē.
Translate together: Puella videt rosam. Who is the subject? What is the verb? The object?
Yes – 'The girl sees the rose.' Now try: Puer moneō Deum – adjust the verb form so it fits the subject.
Answer – Puer monet Deum – 'The boy warns the Lord.' Good!
Faith phrase time: Deus videt – God sees. Say it slowly and clearly three times.
Virtue reflection – Prudentia means seeing wisely and choosing well. How does that connect to our new verbs?
Excellent work! Tomorrow we will practice speed and find English words that grow from these verbs.
